title: You Know Towers are weak when you see this
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MbRiYV5SBAI

Maybe Towers are the only ones that should do %max Hp True damage.

replies.body: This was actually really embarrassing for Riot. We have been calling for strong turrets since last season and after seeing this.. its just making not only LoL but competitive play a joke.

> [{quoted}](name=Annie X Lulu OTP,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aOyXBEAE,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-02-26T12:52:27.549+0000)
>
> This was actually really embarrassing for Riot. We have been calling for strong turrets since last season and after seeing this.. its just making not only LoL but competitive play a joke.

It is a bit silly. I understand in the match he had about 3 activation's on his w shield, locket shield, redemption heal, colossus shield, which made him tank an additional 10-15 hits with his resistances. %hp true damage on nexus turrets could solve it, but can also create an issue closing games.
It would only mean people have to actually push with their minon wave like it should have been.
Which can also make any team advantages counterable by waveclear. There's got to be a balance.

Towers still only target 1 person at a time. If you need to bum rush a tower and trade aggro then taking out a tower is easy, especially if you keep the ADC alive and juggle tower aggro between the tank and everyone else.

And really, if towers did 10% max HP true damage, then it still takes 10 hits to kill champions. That's extremely lenient, especially since a lone squishy can't take 10 hits now.

if towers do 10% max health true damage then early game tower dives become a thing. and it also takes away part of the point in picking a tank and they are already champions that are only viable in high elo or organized teams

On VainGlory, every hit from a turret doubles in damage to what seems an indefinite amount. This makes it so that Tanks can take a few hits but that they can't stay there for more than 3. The turrets also have shields and what not.
Wtf 31 hits is plain out retarded- even for a tank.

You have to keep in mind that Nautilus is pretty fucking stupid right now. His W is super spammable in the late game and it gets to ridiculous sizes with the help of masteries, not to mention all of the healing from the support there. I still miss laser turrets.

Never forget.
#MakeLaserTurretsGreatAgain
You can't make something great again if it never been great in the first place...

that's only because it didn't shoot enough lasers

they should put a rocketlauncher on each turret which only targets champions untill turret falls below 1/3th of its hp
replace the nexus turrets with a Jinx and Kog at full build and 500 armor/mr
Didn't they remove it just because they were too lazy to fix the sound bug?
They did it because it was too difficult to last hit under nexus turrets. xD
No they did it for "clarity".
Then theres people saying "tanks cant tank anymore they die in 0.5 seconds buff tanks wtf roit"

Tanks aren't as strong in Solo Q as they are in competitive. How often do you see 17 level Nautilus with almost full build running around at 30th minute of the game with support healing and shielding him in Solo Q?

Hauntzer was a Super Tank there because:
1. He had a massive exp and gold lead (17 level + 4 items completed and 5th incoming all at 30th minute of the game where tanks are at the peak of their power even with less items completed)
2. Nami had lots of shields and heals for him so he could survive even more and his masteries and SV empowered healing/shielding.
3. Enemy team was starving, zero anti tank itemization, no overall damage.
4. He had his fed team backing him up so he didn't take much damage from their carries.
5. He played one of the top 3 tanks (only because he played one of the strongest tanks doesn't mean that tanks are in a good state and need nerfs).
Maokai died in second there and we could by your logic go with: "wow tanks suck dick, they get blown as fast as squishies".


In Solo Q tanks hardly ever have such a lead because of various things like no communication, almost nonexistant teamplay, various strategies that work in Solo Q but not in the LCS etc.
It also doesn't help that everyone and their mother is playing some assassin and spends the whole game looking for solo kills instead of letting the tank engage

wtf? towers are shit tanking a tower doesn't mean anything. When people say tanks can't tank is saying volibear will die running up to someone trying to flip them. When they say tanks can't tank they mean caitlyn who shouldn't be attacking rammus will fuck him up while he's on his way trying to taunt her. When they say tanks can't tank, they're not talking about nautilus or poppy who BTW have a shield that's helping them doing it ( especially now with the shield buffs ) What they're saying is Nautilus/poppy or GTFO.

They're right for the most part with cleaver + last whisper and the shit tons of lethality. 

The problem is turrets, not tanks. Squishy champions can dive turrets and take 3 shots without dying at lvl 6. Turrets are just pathetic right now, class has nothing to do with it.

Often times, or in the past (some may think currently) players will think of turrets as another champion. So if one enemy dives you under your tower, you'd think you'd have a 2v1 advantage. But when two people dive you, it doesn't quite feel like a 2v2. In the 2 perso dive situation the tower feels like half a champion, so it's more like 1.5 vs 2. I'm thinking that towers should have an ability similar to Irelias passive that it gets stronger the more outnumbered it is, with a defending champion. So if you die under tower, it won't get weak until the aggro has been disconnected from enemy champions. I feel this would make it more fair trying to defend tower Objectives by yourself.
bruh {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

>Maybe Towers are the only ones that should do %max Hp True damage.

No, because tanks should have an advantage in tanking towers. If they don't then it's better just to pick someone like Lee or Elise who can burst under tower and easily drop aggro, it already is better to pick these champs anyway, so this would just exasperate the problem.

What towers need is more flat pen and more ramping damage. This would dissuade tanks somewhat, you wouldn't be able to just face tank 2 towers in the same way Naut did in that clip, but it would still allow tanks to tank out towers in dives. What it hurts though is diving as a squishy. If you're Lee Sin, Zed or Talon and you're trying to tank a tower it should rip you a new one in a matter of seconds, no more squishy champs tanking 8 shots and living.

Hauntzer got tones of shields and heals from his support + he almost got full build at 30th minute of the game + Spirit Visage empowered healing that he was receiving + he was late game Nautilus that can spam his shield like there is no tomorrow.
Towers shouldn't do %max hp true damage because it takes one of the duties away from tanks (why  even bother taking tank to take turret aggro when you can pick any champ and he will tank the same number of hits from turret?)
At least that was a tank, how about the video where a {{champion:43}} tanks like 28 towershots and still walks away with enough HP to dance under it..

poppy can tank 1000 turret shots
That's not the point, we're not saying nerf Nautilus, we're saying, Buff these weak ass turrets.
And the only reason he fell below 50% HP was because he got focused by like 3 enemies.

He procced his W shield several times, was healed by Nami, all three charges of his Corruption potion, and a redemption, all of which were amplified by Spirit Visage, and probably got safeguarded by Lee. It's also Nautilus with 2 health items and 2 armor items, so.

Still. 31 turret shots is too much to be okay for ONE champion to tank, help or no.

Turrets don't do nearly enough damage in late, which I understand that a tank can tank turrets, but 31 shots on ONE champion, and them getting off scott free, is not okay.
I have always been thinking that turrets should have true damage
wait you guys saw any towers ? i didnt see any ... i just saw naut reciving some kind of blessing from 2 shrine 32 times in a row.

Maybe make them lasers again and have them deal %Hp (not max, but instead maybe current or missing) MIXED damage.

Tanks SHOULD be able to tank it for longer, and max hp true damage would make adcs be able to tank just as long (although a short amount of time) unless they also had a base damage.

With %missing mixed, tanks could still tank longer, but they would take more damage the longer they tanked, they can also keep the ramping up of turrets. Meaning late game you can still tank turrets, but unless you have 3 or 4 tanks you cant end the game without minions.
Make towers ignore all shields.

They should make {{item:3056}} target either ally or enemy towers.  If you target an ally tower, increase their attack speed by 100% for like 6 seconds as well as still be able to deactivate enemy towers.
While it is true that he has a big buff on his Armour and multiple healers, 31 tower shots is a bit much to tank out.
Lets not forget that MAJORITY Of the damage he did take was not from the tower. In fact, from what I saw, the tower barely did anything. It was mostly the damage from other champions.

Yes, taking 31 turret shots is pretty dumb, but its a full tank naut, who is getting shields from his support and jungle, and heals from his support, while the other team isnt attacking him because they are trying to position themselves to attack the ashe/syndra behind him.  If they had focused the naut, even with poke, it would have been a much different video.
Although towers are weak,tanks have been able to do this since forever lol
And Riot keeps nerfing tanks that are actually balanced (like Maokai and Poppy). We all know who the real cancer is.
*Pretending Poppy was actually balanced*
tfw I posted this a week ago and nobody gave a fuck and was like "Towers are fine, he was fed and got healed by Nami!!1" .. :^)

I think they should scale the base damage down, but make them deal true damage.  This allows two things:

It allows them to stay relevant during the game.

It allows the player to know exactly how much damage they'll be taking, giving readability to diving.  Sometimes a person just barely dies to that last tower shot, and seeing as every character has differing values in armor, this makes this aspect of diving more clear.

There's probably some good counterpoints as to WHY this would be bad, but just figured I'd post it.
To be fair it's 30 minutes. However, I do think the further in towers are, they should double in power.
Nexus turrets shouldn't be so weak. I don't know how anyone can justify the towers that act as a last resort being so weak. The enemy should work way harder to end.

They wanted faster games it just sucks that this is the way they chose to do it.

I would had prefered more frequent minions waves with stronger turrets so opponent team needs to wave clear in order to protect the tower.

At this point, when a nautilus can tank a tower for 31 shots.. it's just not right.
